Description: Egyptian travertine stemmed cup; flat rim; long upward flaring cylindrical neck on globular body; low splaying foot with drilled concavity; corroded on one side.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Curator's comments: Belongs to type 173 of Aston's classificatory scheme of Egyptian stone vessels. Bevan 2007, 134-43 provides an overview of Egyptian stone vessels, with a discussion of the cultural impact on Cyprus on pp. 152-153. Bibliography: Aston B. 1994, Ancient Egyptian stone vessels: Materias and forms (Heidelberg: Heidelberg Orientverlag). Bevan A. 2007, Stone vessels and values in the Bronze Age Mediterranean (Cambridge: Cambridge University Press).
Bibliographic references: Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 18)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p.25, Fig 41)
